intro: Stachyarrhena longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved stachyarrhena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Stachyarrhena longifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to dry conditions.
